title: And everything went silent
body: I was afraid this would happen after the Bilgewater event. I thought we were supposed to get Fiora's and some Shurima bios. Can we not go back to the old ways?

Thank you!  I'm actually an old (oooold) hand at this game-development shenanigans - been a level designer for comfortably over a decade now, and I've been at Riot for around a year and a half.  Happy I've been able to be some use in that time, even if I'm not the best person for the task.

The Good:
You are all SUPER passionate over here, and think through not only factual elements, but the underlying themes and meanings much deeper than I think many other places might give you lot credit for.  I lurk like crazy, and so I do read some of the longer, more in depth, analysis posts that pop up.  As for the lore, it goes deeeeep here.  A game with this much history means I'm learning new stuff about it all the time - which is both great because learning new stuff is brilliant, and terrifying, because if I put my foot in it through ignorance, I know you guys will set me straight ;D

The Bad:
The players have been burnt by some bad experiences with how the story has been handled in many ways - and their reactions are for the most part totally human and understandable.  Not being able to fix that is super frustrating to me.  On the lore specifically, it's a big bag of mad in many ways - which is great and terrifying!  Some parts I can hardly believe is a real part of the game - but there are always some players who LOVE every element, so I need to remember to respect the parts that I think are too weird to exist :)

The Weird:
Ah, wait.  I think I just talked about that in the bad bit.  Huh.  Well, there's enough weird to go round!  It's weird that Riot talks to players as much as it does (I came from a studio where you'd go internet dark for 5 years, on pain of being fired).  It's weird that they don't talk more!  It's weird that lore goes through so many rounds of approval and stakeholder review.  It's weird that there aren't more ways to make the boundary between official lore and player-lore more porous (I think about that a lot).  I'm kind of weird too.  It's weird that I like being weird.

I can't go into detail right now, but I'll say we've put back some of the Shurima bios for now to concentrate on Shadow Isles. I can't really go into more than that at this point.

My apologies for the delay on Shurima related content, but the team that we've put together to work on champion introductions is very focused on delivering quality content to you in a format such as you saw with the main players in the Bilgewater: Burning Tides event. It's taking us a bit of time as we're working on a number of different things, including getting more story to you in addition to champion intros or champion launches in the months ahead.
